title: Get Started
text: article illustrates use model_set() functions package modelbpp : Fit set neighboring models, one one less degree freedom original fitted model. Compute BIC posterior probability (BPP), model (Wu et al., 2020). Use BPP assess extent model supported data, compared models consideration.

title: Get Started
text: Fit SEM model, original model, usual lavaan. Call model_set() output Step 1. automatically following: Enumerate neighboring models original model. Fit models compute BIC posterior probabilities (BPPs). Examine results : printing output model_set(), generating graph using model_graph().

title: Get Started
text: sample dataset, dat_serial_4_weak, four variables:

title: Get Started
text: Fit original model, serial mediation model, one direct path, x y: summary: fit acceptable, though RMSEA marginal (CFI = 0.958, RMSEA = 0.083).
code: library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-16 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. mod1 <- " m1 ~ x m2 ~ m1 y ~ m2 + x " fit1 <- sem(mod1, dat_serial_4_weak) summary(fit1,         fit.measures = TRUE) #> lavaan 0.6.16 ended normally after 1 iteration #>  #>   Estimator                                         ML #>   Optimization method                           NLMINB #>   Number of model parameters                         7 #>  #>   Number of observations                           100 #>  #> Model Test User Model: #>                                                        #>   Test statistic                                 3.376 #>   Degrees of freedom                                 2 #>   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.185 #>  #> Model Test Baseline Model: #>  #>   Test statistic                                39.011 #>   Degrees of freedom                                 6 #>   P-value                                        0.000 #>  #> User Model versus Baseline Model: #>  #>   Comparative Fit Index (CFI)                    0.958 #>   Tucker-Lewis Index (TLI)                       0.875 #>  #> Loglikelihood and Information Criteria: #>  #>   Loglikelihood user model (H0)               -216.042 #>   Loglikelihood unrestricted model (H1)       -214.354 #>                                                        #>   Akaike (AIC)                                 446.084 #>   Bayesian (BIC)                               464.320 #>   Sample-size adjusted Bayesian (SABIC)        442.212 #>  #> Root Mean Square Error of Approximation: #>  #>   RMSEA                                          0.083 #>   90 Percent confidence interval - lower         0.000 #>   90 Percent confidence interval - upper         0.232 #>   P-value H_0: RMSEA <= 0.050                    0.261 #>   P-value H_0: RMSEA >= 0.080                    0.628 #>  #> Standardized Root Mean Square Residual: #>  #>   SRMR                                           0.050 #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>   m1 ~                                                 #>     x                 0.187    0.059    3.189    0.001 #>   m2 ~                                                 #>     m1                0.231    0.091    2.537    0.011 #>   y ~                                                  #>     m2                0.341    0.089    3.835    0.000 #>     x                 0.113    0.052    2.188    0.029 #>  #> Variances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>    .m1                0.278    0.039    7.071    0.000 #>    .m2                0.254    0.036    7.071    0.000 #>    .y                 0.213    0.030    7.071    0.000

title: Get Started
text: Use model_set() find neighboring models differ target model one model degrees freedom, fit , compute BPPs:
code: out1 <- model_set(fit1)

title: Get Started
text: examine results, just print output: total number models examined, including original model, 9. BIC posterior probabilities (BPPs) suggest original model indeed probable model based BPP. However, model direct path dropped, drop: y~x, slightly lower BPP (0.251) suggests , equal prior probabilities (Wu et al., 2020), support model direct without direct path similar support data based BPP. Alternatively, can use model_graph() visualize BPPs model relations graphically:  node (circle) represents one model. larger BPP, larger node. arrow points simpler model (model larger model df) complicated model (model smaller model df). two models connected arrow, one model can formed another model adding removing one free parameter (e.g., adding removing one path).
code: out1 #>  #> Call: #> model_set(sem_out = fit1) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 9 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 9 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 9 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>             df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> original     0 0.111 464.320 0.253      0.253 #> drop: y~x   -1 0.111 464.340 0.251      0.504 #> add: m1~~y   1 0.111 465.900 0.115      0.619 #> add: y~m1    1 0.111 465.900 0.115      0.733 #> drop: m2~m1 -1 0.111 465.953 0.112      0.845 #> add: m1~y    1 0.111 466.142 0.102      0.947 #> add: m2~x    1 0.111 468.575 0.030      0.977 #> drop: m1~x  -1 0.111 469.403 0.020      0.997 #> drop: y~m2  -1 0.111 473.291 0.003      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability. graph1 <- model_graph(out1) plot(graph1)

title: Get Started
text: real studies, models equally probable data (.e., models equal prior probabilities). researcher fits original model prior probability higher models, least neighboring models (otherwise, worthy collecting data assess thi original model), prior probability high eliminate need collecting data see much supported data. Suppose decide prior probability original model .50: probable, still needs data decide whether empirically supported can done setting prior_sem_out desired prior probability calling model_set(): prior probabilities models equal. Therefore, nine models prior target model .50, prior probability eight model (1 - .50) / 8 .0625. printout: prior target set .50, , taking account prior probabilities data, target model strongly supported data. output model_graph():
code: out1_prior <- model_set(fit1,                         prior_sem_out = .50) out1_prior #>  #> Call: #> model_set(sem_out = fit1, prior_sem_out = 0.5) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 9 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 9 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 9 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>             df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> original     0 0.500 464.320 0.730      0.730 #> drop: y~x   -1 0.062 464.340 0.090      0.821 #> add: m1~~y   1 0.062 465.900 0.041      0.862 #> add: y~m1    1 0.062 465.900 0.041      0.904 #> drop: m2~m1 -1 0.062 465.953 0.040      0.944 #> add: m1~y    1 0.062 466.142 0.037      0.981 #> add: m2~x    1 0.062 468.575 0.011      0.992 #> drop: m1~x  -1 0.062 469.403 0.007      0.999 #> drop: y~m2  -1 0.062 473.291 0.001      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability. graph1_prior <- model_graph(out1_prior) plot(graph1_prior)

title: Get Started
text: desired, can enumerate models “farther away” target model. example, can set maximum difference model df 2, include models two two less df original model: printout. default, 10 models, top 10 models BPP printed: number models examined, including original model, 18. output model_graph():  Note: Due number nodes, node_label_size used reduce size labels.
code: out1_df2 <- model_set(fit1,                       df_change_add = 2,                       df_change_drop = 2) out1_df2 #>  #> Call: #> model_set(sem_out = fit1, df_change_add = 2, df_change_drop = 2) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 18 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 18 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 18 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>                  df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> original          0 0.056 464.320 0.214      0.214 #> drop: y~x        -1 0.056 464.340 0.212      0.426 #> add: m1~~y        1 0.056 465.900 0.097      0.523 #> add: y~m1         1 0.056 465.900 0.097      0.620 #> drop: m2~m1      -1 0.056 465.953 0.095      0.714 #> drop: m2~m1;y~x  -2 0.056 465.973 0.094      0.808 #> add: m1~y         1 0.056 466.142 0.086      0.894 #> add: m2~x         1 0.056 468.575 0.025      0.920 #> drop: m1~x       -1 0.056 469.403 0.017      0.936 #> drop: m1~x;y~x   -2 0.056 469.423 0.017      0.953 #> add: m1~y;m2~x    2 0.056 470.154 0.012      0.965 #> add: m1~~y;m2~x   2 0.056 470.154 0.012      0.976 #> add: m2~x;y~m1    2 0.056 470.154 0.012      0.988 #> drop: m1~x;m2~m1 -2 0.056 471.036 0.007      0.995 #> drop: y~m2       -1 0.056 473.291 0.002      0.998 #> drop: y~m2;y~x   -2 0.056 474.819 0.001      0.999 #> drop: m2~m1;y~m2 -2 0.056 474.924 0.001      1.000 #> drop: m1~x;y~m2  -2 0.056 478.374 0.000      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability. graph1_df2 <- model_graph(out1_df2,                           node_label_size = .75) plot(graph1_df2)

what: Excluding Some Parameters From the Search
title: Get Started
text: calling model_set(), users can specify parameters must excluded list added (must_not_add), must dropped (must_not_drop). example, may make sense add error covariance m1 y (m1~~y). can exclude calling model_set() output: number models reduced 8. plot:
code: out1_no_cov <- model_set(fit1,                          must_not_add = "m1~~y") out1_no_cov #>  #> Call: #> model_set(sem_out = fit1, must_not_add = "m1~~y") #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 8 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 8 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 8 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>             df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> original     0 0.125 464.320 0.286      0.286 #> drop: y~x   -1 0.125 464.340 0.283      0.569 #> add: y~m1    1 0.125 465.900 0.130      0.699 #> drop: m2~m1 -1 0.125 465.953 0.126      0.825 #> add: m1~y    1 0.125 466.142 0.115      0.940 #> add: m2~x    1 0.125 468.575 0.034      0.974 #> drop: m1~x  -1 0.125 469.403 0.023      0.997 #> drop: y~m2  -1 0.125 473.291 0.003      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability. graph1_no_cov <- model_graph(out1_no_cov) plot(graph1_no_cov)

title: Get Started
text: original model equality constraints, included search neighboring models, default. , removing one equality constraint two models considered model increase 1 df.

what: Recompute BPPs Without Refitting the Models
title: Get Started
text: Users can examine impact prior probability original model without refitting models, using output model_set() input, using model_set_out argument: results identical calling model_set() original lavaan output input:
code: out1_new_prior <- model_set(model_set_out = out1,                             prior_sem_out = .50) out1_new_prior #>  #> Call: #> model_set(model_set_out = out1, prior_sem_out = 0.5) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 9 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 9 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 9 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>             df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> original     0 0.500 464.320 0.730      0.730 #> drop: y~x   -1 0.062 464.340 0.090      0.821 #> add: m1~~y   1 0.062 465.900 0.041      0.862 #> add: y~m1    1 0.062 465.900 0.041      0.904 #> drop: m2~m1 -1 0.062 465.953 0.040      0.944 #> add: m1~y    1 0.062 466.142 0.037      0.981 #> add: m2~x    1 0.062 468.575 0.011      0.992 #> drop: m1~x  -1 0.062 469.403 0.007      0.999 #> drop: y~m2  -1 0.062 473.291 0.001      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cheung S, Wu H, Leung S (2023). modelbpp: Model BIC Posterior Probability. R package version 0.1.2, https://sfcheung.github.io/modelbpp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {modelbpp: Model BIC Posterior Probability},   author = {Shu Fai Cheung and Huiping Wu and Shing On Leung},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://sfcheung.github.io/modelbpp/}, }

title: Model BIC Posterior Probability
text: package assessing model uncertainty structural equation modeling (SEM) BIC posterior probabilities fitted model neighboring models, based method presented Wu, Cheung, Leung (2020). package name, modelbpp, stands model bayesian posterior probability. Wu, H., Cheung, S. F., & Leung, S. O. (2020). Simple use BIC assess model selection uncertainty: illustration using mediation moderation models. Multivariate Behavioral Research, 55(1), 1–16. https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2019.1574546

title: Model BIC Posterior Probability
text: information package, please visit GitHub page: https://sfcheung.github.io/modelbpp/

title: Model BIC Posterior Probability
text: latest developmental--stable version package can installed remotes::install_github:
code: remotes::install_github("sfcheung/modelbpp")

what: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
text: Fit list models dataset.

title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
code: fit_many(   model_list,   sem_out,   parallel = FALSE,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores(logical = FALSE) - 1, 1),   make_cluster_args = list(),   progress = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
text: model_list list parameter tables used lavaan::lavaan() update(). Usually generated get_add() get_drop(). sem_out output structural equation modeling function. currently supports lavaan::lavaan objects . Usually one used model_set(), get_add() get_drop() generate list models. parallel TRUE, parallel processing used fit models. Default FALSE. ncores Numeric. number CPU cores used parallel TRUE. make_cluster_args list named arguments passed parallel::makeCluster(). Used advanced users configure cluster parallel TRUE. Default list(). progress Whether progress bar displayed, implemented pbapply package. Default TRUE. verbose Whether additional messages displayed, expected processing time. Default TRUE.

title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
text: object class sem_outs, list following major elements: fit: named list lavaan::lavaan() output objects update() fitting model added parameters. change: numeric vector, length fit. change model df fit compared original model. positive number denotes one less free parameter. negative number denotes one free parameter one less constraint. converged: named vector boolean values, length fit. Indicates whether fit converged . post_check: named vector boolean values, length fit. Indicates whether solution fit admissible . Checked lavaan::lavInspect() argument set "post.check".

title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
text: receives list models, defined lavaan parameter tables (usually generated model_set(), get_add() get_drop()), fit dataset stored lavaan-class object. function called model_set() usually users need call . exported advanced users.

title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Fit a List of Models — fit_many
code: library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-16 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. dat <- dat_path_model mod <- " x3 ~ a*x1 + b*x2 x4 ~ a*x1 ab := a*b " fit <- sem(mod, dat_path_model, fixed.x = TRUE) mod_to_add <- get_add(fit) fit_many(mod_to_add, fit) #>  #> Call: #> fit_many(model_list = mod_to_add, sem_out = fit) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted: 2 #> Number of model(s) converged: 2 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 2 #>  #> The modifications: #> add: x4~x2 #> add: (x3~x1),(x4~x1)

what: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
text: Generate list models one fixed parameter freed.

title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
code: get_add(   sem_out,   must_add = NULL,   must_not_add = NULL,   remove_constraints = TRUE,   exclude_error_cov = TRUE,   df_change = 1,   model_id = NA,   keep_correct_df_change = TRUE,   remove_duplicated = TRUE )

title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
text: sem_out original model, output structural equation modeling function. Currently support lavaan::lavaan objects . must_add character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "y ~ x"), must added. Default NULL. must_not_add character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "x1 ~~ x1"), must added. Default NULL. remove_constraints Whether equality constraints removed. Default TRUE. exclude_error_cov Exclude error covariances indicators. Default TRUE. df_change many degrees freedom (df) away list. models df change less equal number included, taking account requirements set arguments. Default 1. model_id identification number starting model. Default NA, identification number. keep_correct_df_change Keep models actual df change equal expected df change. remove_duplicated TRUE, default, duplicated models removed.

title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
text: object class partables, named list parameter tables, used lavaan::lavaan() update() fitting model added parameters.

title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
text: generates list models one fixed parameter freed (degrees freedom, df, increases one ). model equality constraints, models one constraints two free parameters released also included. Graphically, paths covariances "added" form list models. models included identified lavaan::modificationIndices(). models checked lavaan make sure decrease model degrees freedom expected value. function called model_set() usually users need call . exported advanced users.

title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Models That Are Less Restricted — get_add

what: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
text: Generate list models one free parameter dropped (fixed zero).

title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
code: get_drop(   sem_out,   must_drop = NULL,   must_not_drop = NULL,   df_change = 1,   model_id = NA,   keep_correct_df_change = TRUE,   remove_duplicated = TRUE )

title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
text: sem_out original model, output structural equation modeling function. Currently support lavaan::lavaan objects . must_drop character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "y ~ x"), must included. Default NULL. must_not_drop character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "x1 ~~ x1"), must included. Default NULL. df_change many degrees freedom away list. models df change less equal number included, taking account requirements set arguments. Default 1. model_id identification number starting model. Default NA, identification number. keep_correct_df_change Keep models actual df change equal expected df change. remove_duplicated TRUE, default, duplicated models removed.

title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
text: object class partables, named list parameter tables, used lavaan::lavaan() update() fitting model added parameters.

title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
text: generates list models one free parameters dropped, , fixed zero (degrees freedom, df, increases one ). free parameters included pool candidates, except explicitly requested kept. models checked lavaan make sure increase model degrees freedom expected value. function called model_set() usually users need call . exported advanced users.

title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Models That Are More Restricted — get_drop
Minimum Prior — min_prior
text: Find minimum prior probability required achieve desired BIC posterior probability.

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
code: min_prior(bic, bpp_target, target_name = "original")

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
text: bic named vector BIC values set models. bpp_target value zero 1. desired BIC posterior probability. target_name name original model, appeared names bic.

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
text: scalar. required prior probability.

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
text: assumes models original model prior probabilities. function called model_set() print.model_set() usually users need call . exported advanced users.

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
text: Wu, H., Cheung, S. F., & Leung, S. O. (2020). Simple use BIC assess model selection uncertainty: illustration using mediation moderation models. Multivariate Behavioral Research, 55(1), 1--16. doi:10.1080/00273171.2019.1574546

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Minimum Prior — min_prior
code: library(lavaan)  dat <- dat_path_model  mod <- " x3 ~ a*x1 + b*x2 x4 ~ a*x1 ab := a*b "  fit <- sem(mod, dat_path_model, fixed.x = TRUE)  out <- model_set(fit) min_prior(out$bic, bpp_target = .8) #> [1] 0.9999998

what: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
text: Generate 'igraph' object 'model_set' object.

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
code: model_graph(   object,   node_size_by_x = TRUE,   x = NULL,   node_size = 5,   min_size = 5,   max_size = 35,   color_original = "lightblue",   color_add = "burlywood1",   color_drop = "lightgreen",   color_label = "black",   node_label_size = 1,   ... )

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
text: object Must model_set-class object now. node_size_by_x Logical. Whether node (vertex) sizes determined variable. Default TRUE. See x size determined. x NULL, numeric vector length equal number models. node sizes proportional values x, offset min_size. NULL, default, BIC posterior probabilities stored object retrieved. node_size node_size_by_x FALSE, size nodes. min_size minimum size node. Default 5. max_size maximum size node. Default 35. color_original color node original model. Default "lightblue". color_add color nodes models formed adding one free parameters original model. Default "burlywood1". color_drop color nodes models formed dropping one free parameters original model. Default "lightgreen". color_label color text labels nodes. Default "black". node_label_size size labels nodes. Default 1. ... Optional arguments. used now.

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
text: model_graph-class object can used igraph-object, plot method (plot.model_graph()) settings suitable plotting network models BIC posterior probabilities computed.

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
text: extracts model list stored object, creates adjacency matrix, creates igraph object customized visualizing model relations.

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
text: model connected arrow, pointing one model another model formed . adding one free parameter, b, releasing one equality constraint two parameters. , points model one less degree freedom. default, size node model scaled BIC posterior probability, available. See Size Node . original model, models degrees freedom, models fewer degrees freedom colored differently. default layout Sugiyama layout, simpler models (models fewer degrees freedom) top. lower model network, degrees freedom . layout suitable showing nested relations models. output igraph object. Users can customize way want using functions igraph package.

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
text: model scaled x, usually BIC posterior probability, size determined : max_size * (x - min(x))/(max(x) - min(x)) + min_size

title: Generate a Graph of Models — model_graph
code: library(lavaan)  mod <- " m1 ~ x y ~ m1 "  fit <- sem(mod, dat_serial_4, fixed.x = TRUE)  out <- model_set(fit) out #>  #> Call: #> model_set(sem_out = fit) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 4 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 4 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 4 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>            df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> original    0 0.250 370.869 0.880      0.880 #> add: y~x    1 0.250 374.847 0.120      1.000 #> drop: y~m1 -1 0.250 431.244 0.000      1.000 #> drop: m1~x -1 0.250 469.045 0.000      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability.  g <- model_graph(out) plot(g)

what:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: Identify neighboring models, fit , return BIC posterior probabilities.

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
code: model_set(   sem_out,   partables = NULL,   model_set_out = NULL,   prior_sem_out = NULL,   must_add = NULL,   must_not_add = NULL,   must_drop = NULL,   must_not_drop = NULL,   remove_constraints = TRUE,   exclude_error_cov = TRUE,   df_change_add = 1,   df_change_drop = 1,   remove_duplicated = TRUE,   fit_models = ifelse(!is.null(model_set_out$fit), FALSE, TRUE),   compute_bpp = TRUE,   parallel = FALSE,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores(logical = FALSE) - 1, 1),   make_cluster_args = list(),   progress = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   skip_check_sem_out = FALSE )  gen_models(   sem_out,   must_add = NULL,   must_not_add = NULL,   must_drop = NULL,   must_not_drop = NULL,   remove_constraints = TRUE,   exclude_error_cov = TRUE,   df_change_add = 1,   df_change_drop = 1,   remove_duplicated = TRUE,   output = c("partables", "model_set") )

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: sem_out output SEM function. Currently supports lavaan::lavaan objects . partables partables-class object, usually generated get_add() get_drop(). named list parameter tables fitted along original model sem_out. supplied, arguments related identifying models ignored. Default NULL. model_set_out set output previous call model_set() (model_set-class object), list stored models used. arguments related generate neighboring models ignored. supplied, sem_out also ignored retrieved model_set_out, partables also ignored. Default NULL. prior_sem_out prior model fitted sem_out. Default NULL, models equal prior probabilities. must_add character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "y ~ x"), must added. Default `NULL``. must_not_add character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "x1 ~~ x1"), must added. Default NULL. must_drop character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "y ~ x"), must included. Default NULL. must_not_drop character vector parameters, named lavaan::lavaan() style (e.g., "x1 ~~ x1"), must included. Default NULL. remove_constraints Whether equality constraints removed. Default ``TRUE`. exclude_error_cov Exclude error covariances indicators. Default TRUE. df_change_add many degrees freedom (df) away list. models df change less equal number included, taking account requirements set arguments. Default 1. df_change_drop many degrees freedom away list. models df change less equal number included, taking account requirements set arguments. Default 1. remove_duplicated TRUE, default, duplicated models removed. fit_models TRUE, models fitted data, usually stored sem_out. FALSE, models returned , element models output. model_set_out set models fitted, default FALSE. Otherwise, default TRUE. compute_bpp TRUE, BIC posterior probabilities computed. Default TRUE. parallel TRUE, parallel processing used fit models. Default FALSE. ncores Numeric. number CPU cores used parallel TRUE. make_cluster_args list named arguments passed parallel::makeCluster(). Used advanced users configure cluster parallel TRUE. Default list(). progress Whether progress bar displayed, implemented pbapply package. Default TRUE. verbose Whether additional messages displayed, expected processing time. Default TRUE. skip_check_sem_out TRUE sem_out set, check whether sem_out supported type (estimator "ML" model one group). , error raised. Can set FALSE experimenting functions models officially supported. output "model_est", output model_set-class object. "partables", output partables-class object. Default partables.

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: function model_set() returns object class model_set, list following major elements: models: named list parameter tables. represent models identified. bic: numeric vector, length model. BIC model. postprob: numeric vector, length model. BIC posterior probability model. fit: named list lavaan::lavaan() output objects update() fitting model added parameters, length model. change: numeric vector, length model. change model df fit. positive number denotes one less free parameter. negative number denotes one free parameter one less constraint. converged: named vector boolean values, length model. Indicates whether fit converged . post_check: named vector boolean values, length model. Indicates whether solution fit admissible . Checked lavaan::lavInspect(). object returned gen_models() depends argument output. See argument output details

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: computes BIC posterior probabilities set models method presented Wu, Cheung, Leung (2020). First, list model identified based user-specified criteria. default, models differ fitted model one degree freedom, 1-df-away neighboring models, found using get_add() get_drop. Second, models fitted sample dataset, BICs computed. Third, BIC posterior probabilities computed using BICs. default, equal prior probabilities models fitted assumed current version. can changed prior_sem_out. results can printed, models sorted descending order BIC posterior probabilities. results can also visualized using model_graph().

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: model_set(): Compute BPPs list models. Can generate models /fit models. Can also accept pregenerated models, just update BPPs. gen_models(): Generate list models (parameter tables).

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: Wu, H., Cheung, S. F., & Leung, S. O. (2020). Simple use BIC assess model selection uncertainty: illustration using mediation moderation models. Multivariate Behavioral Research, 55(1), 1--16. doi:10.1080/00273171.2019.1574546

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title:
BIC Posterior Probabilities
of Neighboring Models — model_set
code: library(lavaan)  dat <- dat_path_model  mod <- " x3 ~ a*x1 + b*x2 x4 ~ a*x1 ab := a*b "  fit <- sem(mod, dat_path_model, fixed.x = TRUE)  out <- model_set(fit) out #>  #> Call: #> model_set(sem_out = fit) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted           : 5 #> Number of model(s) converged        : 5 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 5 #>  #> The models (sorted by BPP): #>                      df Prior     BIC   BPP Cumulative #> add: x4~x2            1 0.200 400.291 1.000      1.000 #> original              0 0.200 431.452 0.000      1.000 #> add: (x3~x1),(x4~x1)  1 0.200 435.397 0.000      1.000 #> drop: x3~~x4         -1 0.200 441.229 0.000      1.000 #> drop: x3~x2          -1 0.200 455.926 0.000      1.000 #>  #> Note: #> - BIC: Bayesian Information Criterion. #> - BPP: BIC posterior probability. #> - Cumulative: Cumulative BIC posterior probability.

what: modelbpp: Model BIC Posterior Probability — modelbpp-package
title: modelbpp: Model BIC Posterior Probability — modelbpp-package
text: Fits neighboring models fitted structural equation model assesses model uncertainty fitted model based BIC posterior probabilities, using method presented Wu, Cheung, Leung (2020) doi:10.1080/00273171.2019.1574546 .

title: modelbpp: Model BIC Posterior Probability — modelbpp-package
text: Maintainer: Shu Fai Cheung shufai.cheung@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Huiping Wu Shing Leung (ORCID)

title: Print a model_set-Class Object — print.model_set
text: x model_set-class object. bic_digits number decimal places displayed BIC. Default 3. bpp_digits number decimal places displayed BIC posterior probability prior probabilities. Default 3. sort_models Whether models sorted BIC posterior probability. Default TRUE. max_models maximum number models printed. Default 20. bpp_target desired BIC probability. Used compute print minimum prior probability target model required achieve bpp_target. Default NULL. ... Optional arguments. Ignored.

title: Print an sem_outs-Class Object — print.sem_outs
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448

title: Print an sem_outs-Class Object — print.sem_outs
code: library(lavaan) dat <- dat_path_model mod <- " x3 ~ a*x1 + b*x2 x4 ~ a*x1 ab := a*b " fit <- sem(mod, dat_path_model, fixed.x = TRUE) mod_to_add <- get_add(fit) out <- fit_many(mod_to_add, fit) out #>  #> Call: #> fit_many(model_list = mod_to_add, sem_out = fit) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted: 2 #> Number of model(s) converged: 2 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 2 #>  #> The modifications: #> add: x4~x2 #> add: (x3~x1),(x4~x1)  print(out, max_models = 1) #>  #> Call: #> fit_many(model_list = mod_to_add, sem_out = fit) #>  #> Number of model(s) fitted: 2 #> Number of model(s) converged: 2 #> Number of model(s) passed post.check: 2 #>  #> The first 1 modifications(s): #> add: x4~x2

(0.1.0.9002) Fixed typos README.md. (0.1.0.9003) Used tinytest tests. (0.1.0.9004 - 0.1.0.9006) Simplified examples. (0.1.0.9007) Pregenerated figures (0.1.1.9001) Finalized 0.1.2.
